alert.note: Alert for Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 20 at 7:02AM EST until January 20 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...Southeast Raleigh and Southeast Fayette Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM EST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Additional information can be found at https://www.weather.gov/rlx as well as on our Facebook and Twitter pages.
